answers.answer: It should not have any impact on ur pregnancy u have the samw eisk as anyone else.  I am over weight and currently 40+1 and have had a great pregnancy.
That's what my bmi was when I got pregnant and I'm 39 weeks and have had a completely healthy pregnancy. I think in order for it to cause complications you would need to be a bit heavier.

Well, you're wayyyyy to early to have developed GB. High BMI/being bigger can lead to pre-eclampsia ....be mindful if what you're eating and try your best to minimize excessive weight gain. I'm a bigger girl too and I have only gained 11 lbs at 36 weeks! You can do it! Eat LOTS of good stuff and say active!

question: Hi everyone. .So  am 6 weeks 2 days pregnant. ..my BMI is about 31 ..u think that having high bmi or being a little obese could affect my pregnancy or could cause any misscarriage?? I don't have gestational diabetes though. ..Thanks
title: high BMI
